name: Redmi Note 12
description: 128GB 6GB RAM, 128GB 8GB RAM, 256GB 8GB RAM, 256GB 12GB RAM, 50 MP, f/1.9, 24mm (wide), 1/1.56, 1.0µm, PDAF, OIS 8 MP, f/2.2, 120˚ (ultrawide), 1/4, 1.12µm 2 MP, f/2.4, (macro), Mediatek MT6877V Dimensity 1080 (6 nm), Li-Po 5000 mAh, non-removable, The Redmi Note 12 Pro employs a 6.67-inch Flow AMOLED screen of extended 1080p resolution (395ppi). It has a small perforation to make way for the selfie camera and Gorilla Glass 5 protection. According to the official specs, the OLED should be the same as on the Redmi Note 12 Pro+.

name: Samsung Galaxy S21 FE 5G
description: 128GB 6GB RAM, 128GB 8GB RAM, 256GB 6GB RAM, 256GB 8GB RAM, 12 MP, f/1.8, 26mm (wide), 1/1.76, 1.8µm, Dual Pixel PDAF, OIS 8 MP, f/2.4, 76mm (telephoto), 1/4.5, 1.0µm, PDAF, OIS, 3x optical zoom 12 MP, f/2.2, 13mm, 123˚ (ultrawide), 1/3.0, 1.12µm, Qualcomm SM8350 Snapdragon 888 5G (5 nm) - Version 1 Exynos 2100 (5 nm) - Version 2, Li-Ion 4500 mAh, non-removable,The Samsung Galaxy S21 FE 5G has a 6.4-inch Dynamic AMOLED 2X display - an update over the S20 FE's 6.5 Super AMOLED. It still has the usual 1,080 x 2,400 px resolution (411ppi), supports a 120Hz refresh rate and Always-on features. The touch sampling rate when using Game Mode is 240Hz, otherwise, it should be 120Hz

name: Samsung Galaxy A54
description: 128GB 4GB RAM, 128GB 6GB RAM, 128GB 8GB RAM, 256GB 6GB RAM, 256GB 8GB RAM, 50 MP, f/1.8, (wide), 1/1.56, 1.0µm, PDAF, OIS 12 MP, f/2.2, 123˚ (ultrawide), 1.12µm 5 MP, f/2.4, (macro), Exynos 1380 (5 nm), Li-Po 5000 mAh, non-removable, Galaxy A54 comes with a slightly smaller display - not that the move from a 6.5-inch to a 6.4-inch diagonal would be noticeable outside of spec sheet comparisons. It's still a 1080p OLED panel (1,080x2,340px resolution, 19.5:9 aspect, 403 ppi pixel density), and it maintains the 120Hz refresh rate with some adaptive capability

name: Samsung Galaxy Note 10
description: 256GB 8GB RAM, 12 MP, f/1.5-2.4, 27mm (wide), 1/2.55, 1.4µm Dual Pixel PDAF, OIS 12 MP, f/2.1, 52mm (telephoto), 1/3.6, 1.0µm, PDAF, OIS, 2x optical zoom 16 MP, f/2.2, 12mm (ultrawide), 1/3.1, 1.0µm, Super Steady video, Exynos 9825 (7 nm) - EMEA/LATAM Qualcomm SM8150 Snapdragon 855 (7 nm) - USA/China, Li-Ion 3500 mAh, non-removable, The Galaxy Note10, compact as it may be, has a 6.3-inch display with a surface area almost the size of the Note8's - a bigger phone in every direction. It's got a 2280x1080px resolution
